intro: Heliosperma quadrifidum var. villosum, commonly known as the hairy heliosperma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
